title: Studying properties of the SU(2) QCD by lattice field theory methods
summary: We present new results on properties of $SU(2)$ QCD in lattice regularization. Our main goal is to find the transition line confinement - deconfinement in $μ- T$ plane. We compute the Polyakov loop and the string tension to determine this line.

AI.tldr: The paper presents new findings on the properties of $SU(2)$ QCD in lattice regularization, with a focus on determining the confinement-deconfinement transition line in the $\mu - T$ plane using the Polyakov loop and string tension.
AI.motivation: The motivation is to better understand the phase structure of $SU(2)$ QCD by identifying the transition between confinement and deconfinement phases as a function of chemical potential ($\mu$) and temperature (T).
AI.method: The method involves computing the Polyakov loop and the string tension within the framework of lattice QCD to map out the transition line in the $\mu - T$ plane.
AI.result: The results include the determination of the confinement-deconfinement transition line in the $\mu - T$ plane for $SU(2)$ QCD, which provides insights into the phase diagram of the theory.
AI.conclusion: The conclusion would likely summarize the significance of the determined transition line for understanding the behavior of $SU(2)$ QCD under varying conditions of chemical potential and temperature, and its implications for the broader field of quantum chromodynamics.

title: Long-distance contributions to kaon decays on the lattice
comment: Proceedings for the 17th International Conference on Heavy Quarks and Leptons (HQL2025), 15-19 September, 2025, Peking University, Beijing, China
summary: In the past decades, significant improvements have been made on standard-model predictions on kaon decays using lattice quantum chromodynamics. In these proceedings, I review selected works on long-distance contributions to kaon decays and developments on QED corrections to those.

AI.tldr: The paper reviews the advancements in predicting kaon decays using lattice quantum chromodynamics, focusing on long-distance contributions and QED corrections.
AI.motivation: To provide an overview of the recent progress in the field of kaon decay predictions, particularly regarding long-distance effects and the inclusion of QED corrections to enhance the accuracy of standard model predictions.
AI.method: The paper conducts a review of selected works that have contributed to the understanding of kaon decays through the application of lattice QCD techniques, with an emphasis on how these studies have addressed long-distance contributions and incorporated QED corrections.
AI.result: The review highlights the significant improvements in the precision of kaon decay predictions by accounting for long-distance contributions and QED effects, which are essential for testing the standard model and searching for new physics.
AI.conclusion: The incorporation of long-distance contributions and QED corrections into lattice QCD calculations has led to more accurate predictions of kaon decays, which is crucial for high-precision tests of the standard model and the potential discovery of new physics phenomena.
